channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: New analog chip capable of outperforming top-end GPUs by as much as 1000x
item.description:
"Benchmarking shows that our analogue computing approach could offer a 1,000 times higher throughput and 100 times better energy efficiency than state-of-the-art digital processors for the same precision. RELATED STORIES—'Crazy idea' memory device could slash AI energy consumption by up to 2,500 times—'Rainbow-on-a-chip' could help keep AI energy demands in check — and it was created by accident—Scientists create ultra-efficient magnetic 'universal memory' that consumes much less energy than previous prototypesThe researchers said that recent advances in memory hardware could make analog computing viable once again. Configuring the chip in this way meant that the team was able to combine the speed of analog computation with the accuracy normally associated with digital processing.

Read more

item.title: Intent to Deprecate and Remove XSLT
item.description:
For these reasons, Chromium would like to deprecate and remove XSLT. Both other browser engines are also planning to deprecate XSLT. Removal of this feature constitutes a compat risk, since sites that use XSLT may stop working when the feature is removed.

Read more

item.title: The profitable startup
item.description:
Profitability isn't unambitious; it's controlling your own destiny. Maybe it's investors whispering that your team is "understaffed compared to benchmarks. When you hire less, you naturally hire better.

Read more

item.title: Fungus: The Befunge CPU(2015)
item.description:
This paper describes Fungus, an architecture designed and optimised for Funge. The author visualises the implementation of Funge compilers to generate Fungus-native code. Fungus: the Funge Machine (PDF)fungus.

Read more

item.title: Photographing the rare brown hyena stalking a diamond mining ghost town
item.description:
The brown hyena is the rarest species of hyena in the world. During his initial visits, he became convinced that a brown hyena was roaming the ghost town at night. The brown hyena is a shy animal, mainly active at night.

Read more

item.title: Tim Bray on Grokipedia
item.description:
Style · The writing has that LLM view-from-nowhere flat-affect semi-academic flavor. I don’t like it but the evidence suggests that some people do. But still, it’s broadly doing what they advertise: Pushing back against “woke” positions, in this case the position that monopolization is bad.

Read more

item.description:
Online, I read from other MacBook Pro owners that the fan mostly stays off. The previous MacBook Air M1 had amazing all-day battery life already, and this MacBook Pro M4 lasts even longer. So if you’re working with a system that has <8ms.

item.title: S.a.r.c.a.s.m: Slightly Annoying Rubik's Cube Automatic Solving Machine
item.description:
M Slightly Annoying Rubik's Cube Automatic Solving Machine S. ILI9341 display with custom 2D&3D graphics, animations, and lip-sync. Stepper + servos for cube handling with position sensors to detect faults.

item.title: Show HN: Strange Attractors
item.description:
The Basics: Dynamical Systems and Chaos Theory Dynamical Systems are a mathematical way to understand how things change over time. Chaos Theory deals with systems that exhibit irregular and unpredictable behavior over time, even though they follow deterministic rules. As discussed earlier, dynamical systems are all about change over time.

Read more

item.title: If a pilot ejects, what is the autopilot programmed to do? (2018)
item.description:
There is nothing much autopilot can do at that point. There have been two famous incidents that are related to your question but afaik neither of them involve Auto Pilot. Hence I'm sorry I don't have an answer to that question.

Read more

item.title: A theoretical way to circumvent Android developer verification
item.description:
Link to the Android documentation, link to FAQ Why this is bad This has already been discussed by ArsTechnica and on some threads (some cherry-picked ones): reddit, ycombinator, hackaday. My answer to this question is that it would simply prevent small developers from distributing their apps, including myself. This can be achieved by patching the target apk bytecode:.

item.title: How to build silos and decrease collaboration on purpose
item.description:
Increasing collaboration can do harm In general, you should aim to maximize collaboration within teams, and minimize collaboration between teams. Why maximize collaboration within teams. Why minimize collaboration between teams.

item.title: Leaker reveals which Pixels are vulnerable to Cellebrite phone hacking
item.description:
The screenshot includes data on the Pixel 6, Pixel 7, Pixel 8, and Pixel 9 family. This blurry screenshot appears to list which Pixel phones Cellebrite devices can hack. Credit: rogueFed This blurry screenshot appears to list which Pixel phones Cellebrite devices can hack.

item.title: Perfetto: Swiss army knife for Linux client tracing
item.description:
First, what is Perfetto. It’s a C++ library that parses the protobuf format, but also a bunch of other widely used trace formats. It’s very important to note that even though the Perfetto UI is web-based, everything happens inside your browser and trace data never leaves your system.

Read more

item.description:
As part of our Public Data Project, LIL recently launched Data. However, static hosting often diminishes the capacity for rich data discovery. Here’s how it works: Data storage: We store Data.

item.title: Futurelock: A subtle risk in async Rust
item.description:
This function only // returns once the lock has been taken in the background task. Returns once the task is holding the lock. At this point:the background task holds the lockthe main task is blocked in tokio::select.

Read more

item.title: Fire TV: Amazon to block piracy apps in the future
item.description:
The background is that Amazon will actively take action against such piracy apps starting today, Friday. They understand that this is a valuable tool for developers. Fire TV players are repeatedly offered on the internet with piracy apps that are supposed to enable free access to IPTV or VoD content.

Read more

item.title: Pangolin (YC S25) Is Hiring a Full Stack Software Engineer (Open-Source)
item.description:
5% equity Years of experience: 3+ Skills: TypeScript, Go, SQL (PostgreSQL, SQLite), NextJS, AWS About Pangolin Pangolin delivers identity-aware remote access to internal apps and services, starting with secure reverse tunneling, and is evolving toward broader zero‑trust networking. You’ll work primarily on the Pangolin container, the central server with the UI, APIs, schemas, and more. Send your resume/CV Send your GitHub profile and highlight any past projects.

Read more

item.title: Another European agency shifts off US Tech as digital sovereignty gains steam
item.description:
It's the latest move in a European trend to shift away from Big Tech. European governments and agencies want to control sensitive data. This shift away from proprietary, foreign-owned cloud services, such as Microsoft 365, to an open-source, European-based cloud service aligns with a growing trend among European governments and agencies.

Read more

item.title: x86 architecture 1 byte opcodes
item.description:
REX2 JODf64Jb JNODf64Jb JBDf64Jb JNBDf64Jb JZDf64 Jb JNZDf64 Jb JBEDf64Jb JNBEDf64Jb JKZDv64 vKw,Jbv(K1OM) JKNZDv64 vKw,Jbv(K1OM) 8xh group #1Eb,Ib group #1Ev,Iz group #1*I64Eb,Ib group #1Ev,Ib TESTEb,Gb TESTEv,Gv XCHGEb,Gb XCHGEv,Gv 9xh (F3h) PAUSEXCHG rAX,rAX XCHG rCX,rAX XCHG r9,rAX XCHG r17,rAXXCHG r25,rAX XCHG rDX,rAX XCHG r10,rAX XCHG r18,rAXXCHG r26,rAX XCHG rBX,rAX XCHG r11,rAX XCHG r19,rAXXCHG r27,rAX XCHG rSP,rAX XCHG r12,rAX XCHG r20,rAXXCHG r28,rAX XCHG rBP,rAX XCHG r13,rAX XCHG r21,rAXXCHG r29,rAX XCHG rSI,rAX XCHG r14,rAX XCHG r22,rAXXCHG r30,rAX XCHG rDI,rAX XCHG r15,rAX XCHG r23,rAXXCHG r31,rAX XCHG r8,rAXXCHG r16,rAXXCHG r24,rAX Axh. REX) MOV BH,Ib(REX) MOV DIL,IbMOV R15B,IbMOV R23B,IbMOV R31B,Ib Cxh group #2Eb,Ib(80186+) group #2Ev,Ib(80186+) RET nearDf64Iw RET nearDf64 LESI64 Gv,Mp (w:v) LDSI64 Gv,Mp (w:v) group #11Eb,Ib group #11Ev,Iz VEX3 VEX2 Dxh group #2Eb,1 group #2Ev,1 group #2Eb,CL group #2Ev,CL AAMI64 Ib AADI64 Ib S(ET)ALCI64 XLAT reserved REX2 L1OM UDB Exh. XCHG eAX,eAX – wider 32-bit NOP (80386) XCHG rAX, rAX – wider 64-bit NOP (x86-64) In PM64 with O32, XCHG EAX,EAX must not zero the upper 32 bits of RAX.

Read more

item.title: AI scrapers request commented scripts
item.description:
A few of these came from user-agents that were obviously malicious: Gulper Web Bot 0. A charitable interpretation for this behaviour is that the scrapers are correctly parsing HTML, but then digging into the text of comments and parsing that recursively to search for URLs that might have been disabled. There are many trivially detectable bot behaviours that I would consider incidental, which is to say that their authors could easily modify those behaviours if they realized that it made their bots less effective.

Read more

item.title: Ask HN: Who uses open LLMs and coding assistants locally? Share setup and laptop
item.description:
Dear Hackers, I’m interested in your real-world workflows for using open-source LLMs and open-source coding assistants on your laptop (not just cloud/enterprise SaaS). , Ollama, LM Studio, or others) and which open-source coding assistant/integration (for example, a VS Code plugin) you’re using. What laptop hardware do you have (CPU, GPU/NPU, memory, whether discrete GPU or integrated, OS) and how it performs for your workflow.

Read more

item.title: Git CLI tool for intelligently creating branch names
item.description:
See alias command for more details Commands init alias issues create init gibr includes an init command to help you create your. See the following usage example: $ gibr init Welcome to gibr setup. Branch naming convention gibr uses the branch_name_format from your.

item.title: Immutable releases are now generally available on GitHub
item.description:
About immutable releases Immutable releases offer: Immutable assets: Once you publish a release as immutable, its assets can’t be added, modified, or deleted. Once enabled: All new releases are immutable (i. They remain immutable.

Read more

item.title: The cryptography behind electronic passports
item.description:
Such passports display a small symbol indicating an electronic machine-readable travel document (eMRTD), which digitally stores the same personal data printed in traditional passport booklets in its embedded filesystem. Electronic passport basicsA passport serves as official identity documentation, primarily for international travel. Figure 5: Example passport with MRZ (ICAO Doc 9303 Part 3)Digging into the threat modelElectronic passports operate under a straightforward threat model that categorizes attackers based on physical access: those who hold a passport versus those who don’t.

Read more
